Police in Chicago have charged four black suspects with a hate crime after a disabled white teenager was beaten and tortured live on Facebook. 
Jordan Hill, 18, Tesfaye Cooper, 18, Brittany Covington, 18, and her sister, Tanishia Covington, 24, were all also charged with aggravated kidnapping, aggravated unlawful restraint and aggravated battery with a deadly weapon. 
The victim knew Hill from school and had initially met up with him voluntarily. 
Police said Hill had picked him up in a stolen van which the pair had slept in before travelling to the Covington sisters' apartment on Tuesday morning. Jordan Hill (Photo: Chicago Police Department) Brittany Covington (Photo: Chicago Police Department) Tesfaye Cooper (Photo: Chicago Police Department) Tanishia Covington (Photo: Chicago Police Department) 
Hours later, a 'play fight' between the victim and Hill got out of hand and the incident turned sinister. 
The boy, who suffers from learning difficulties, was bound and gagged as he was kicked, punched and slapped by the suspects. 
In highly upsetting footage, the perpetrators can be heard laughing and saying "F*** Donald Trump" and "F*** white people" as they cut the boy's clothes.
